revised_title: Interface Chemistry in the Nucleation and Growth Reaction of KBr and Cl Gas
tldr: This study investigates the gas-solid reaction between crystalline potassium bromide (KBr) and chlorine gas, focusing on the interface participating in the nucleation and growth process. The research examines the role of crystal imperfections and the involvement of a liquid halogen phase at the interface, which contributes to the reaction mechanism. The findings provide insights into the form and function of reaction nuclei and challenge previous mechanistic conclusions.
